review_blob: Bottle. Unimpressive nose. Only a tiny, tiny bit of smoke. Modicum of citrus. Smoothish, but slightly acidic. OK finish.
Marginally less bad than Miller Lite. Kind of soapy. I dont see how people drink so much of this stuff.
This is my brothers favorite and my least favorite. Like every other light beer, but with even less reward.
Mediocre pour; decent nose; a bit foamy in the mouth; mediocre flavor; finish is only OK.

Bottle. Figured Id try it since it was on clearance at World Market for 3.99 a 6-pack. The deScriptions in the other reviews are dead-on. Not unremarkable, but also not that great. Definitely better than        xxxxxx light, though. Great value this time, but I wouldnt pay full price.
beer_name: Buffalo Bills Orange Blossom Cream Ale

review_blob: Somewhat acidic and fairly dry. Minimal head. Thinnish. Smoothish. Lots of "-ish" in this beer.
Nice full taste with very low bitterness. When it is on tap, it is usually my choice. Good. Cheap. Plentiful (in Texas). yay.
Great for the value and usually the only non-piss beer on tap in Texas. While this beer is tasty, watch out for its rough morning after, if you know what I mean.

Kind of nasty, but packs a bit more punch than most other beers. Not very enjoyable but perfect for the kegger after the big game. whee. 

Be careful, though. This stuff is responsible for my second worst hangover ever.

Every memory I have of this beveridge involves heavy intoxication. Thats because thats what it is for. Its taste doesnt warrant sipping. Ahh... memories of smashing and empty grenade on the floor of a non-deScript Juarez bar and shouting "Otro!". Good times -- trashy beer.
Aaah...  memories of college when I used to stock the mini-fridge with this junk. Why? because it was cheap and it was beer. It is still cheap and it is still beer (technically).
Potent and bursting with flavor.  Lighter than most barley wines.  Finishes smoother than most barley wines too.

Absolutely on of my favorites!  Not a gimmick stout -- just damn good.  Strong, dark, complex, lasting flavor -- all the qualities I look for in a stout.  They could change the name to "Gold Standard" but that wouldnt portray the sinister essence of a good stout as well as its current title.
beer_name: North Coast Old Rasputin Russian Imperial Stout

review_blob: One of the better beers Ive sampled.  Not my favorite, but Id drink it again.  Very full flavored with ample complexity.  Plenty of roastiness which I like.
A pretty decent red.  Not exactly bursting with a variety of flavors, but smooth and pleasant nonetheless.  Good with pizza and not very expensive at all.

I bought this because of the high reviews.  I might have thought more highly of it had I not expected something truly special.  I felt it was a little light for something called XXX stout.  Ive seen it compared to Guinness but I strongly disagree with that comparison.  Decent but not stellar.

beer_brewer_name: Portland Brewing Company (Pyramid - North American Breweries)
review_blob: Nice characteristic appearance.  Starts smooth but ends a little on the bitter side.  OK but not particularly remarkable.
UPDATED: MAY 16, 2005

beer_brewer_name: Portland Brewing Company (Pyramid - North American Breweries)
review_blob: Sort of a generic honeybeer.  Nothing special about it at all.  I didnt hate it but if Im going to give MacTarnahans my money, Ill buy Blackwatch.
Wow!  This brew really lives up to the hype.  A wealth of complexity.  Great smooth finish.  Wonderful aftertaste.

Very nice color and aroma.  A pleasant although not world class flavor.  Pretty sweet and very "brown" tasting.  A lack of depth and subtlety is what keeps it from being great.  However, its low price and grocery store availability balance it out.  More than worth the low cost.
Decent for a Euro style Japanese beer.  The head was less than I expected.  Quite smooth despite its other ho-hum qualities.  Although not outstanding, it was still a well above average beer.
Mmmm... roasty.  A very smooth stout with pleanty of body.  Nice coffee presence.
A bit fruity with loads of malty character.  One of the better high alcohol ales Ive had the pleasure of drinking.
A quality ale true to its type.  Although on the fuller side, I thought it was a bit lighter than most of the other reviews here indicated.

Mullet beer at its best/worst.  If you can stomach this vile liquid, it is a very cheap way to get drunk.  I used to work in a liquor store in Lubbock, TX and on occasion we would move over 350 cases of this sewage a day!  How, in the name of hops, does this happen?!?

This interesting brew finishes much better than it starts.  At 7.2% it is fairly potent.  At first the maltiness whacked me over the head, but as I finished it, the flavor seemed more balanced.  Overall, I was much happier with it near the end than the beginning.
Very carbonated.  Not bursting with flavor -- it is listed as super dry, after all).  Despite the above, it is quite refreshing.  A very interesting beer.
Good beer with an honorable complexity.  The other reviews are right.  This is one smokey beer.  I like the finish.  nice caramel permeated aroma.
A pretty decent banquet beer.  Great for washing down fajitas.  Not too exciting, but good nonetheless.
Of the family of uneventful Amarican domestics, this is way more decent than most.  Very clean finish.  Refreshing.  Not exciting.  Not repulsive.  OK.
This is not a very classy beer.  However, for $5 & change per 6 pack, it is worth picking up.
Of the "party beers", this is definitely one of my favorites.  It has more flavor than its green-bottled compadre.  Nice and malty.  I've consumed quite a few of these.
A little thin for my taste as far as schwarzbier is concerned.  Not bad, but there are quite a few beers I prefer to this one.

I didn't think it tasted too much like India Pale Ale.  But that alone doesn't mean much.  The taste, however does.  I found the flavor to be somewhat devoid of excitement.  It's not that it was without character, just not tasty in my opinion.  Too yeasty for me.  Not enough body to the taste.  It also seemed to be excessively carbonated which is strange since it yeilded very little head.  I must admit that I don't fully understand this beer.
A simple beer, but good nonetheless.  This is not an artsy-fartsy beer.  It is more utilitarian. Damn good with a pepperoni pizza!
UPDATED: MAY 16, 2005
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2009

Sometimes, when this is the least of several evils available at a free open bar or party, I will drink this beer.  At least the piss to water ratio is marginally higher than budweiser.  My diminished disdain for this beer is probably my Dad's fault since my bro and I used to sneak little sips of his "yellow dogs" when he got up to go to the restroom.  As such, it was our first taste of beer.  If a 7 year old can stomach it, it's too weak.  Poor Dad.  Little did he know.
You can't even call it piss.  It's more like diluted piss.  It really tates like dirty water to me.  An abomination reserved for culinary Philistines.

Not the best tasting beer ever, but it has a distinctive character.  Makes me think of Mexican food and conjures up memories of some fun times south of the border.  I like to drink this beer occasionally for nostalgic reasons.
Pretty decent.  pretty good flavor, but took too long for the roastiness to peek out from behind a few slightly less desirable flavors.  I definitely like it better than regular Heineken.

Ok - so the main reason I reviewed this beer so highly is that it is the best beer at the HEB supermarket for under $6 per 6-pack.  This isn't a flashy beer, it is very functional.  It compliments a Hibachi steak very well.  It is one of the few beers my wife and I actually agree on.  Light enough for her, tasty enough for me, and less than a buck a bottle.  Not a world champ, but something I like to keep in the fridge.
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2009
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2009
UPDATED: MAY 16, 2005
